Date Published: December 12, 2020   |   Author: Sophie Su   |   Length: 259 Words

Women in Computing - Club Involvement

The objectives of the Women in Computing Club are to promote women in the field of computing, to expand women’s knowledge and computing experiment with collegially other like-minded people in a casual fun environment. It is a great opportunity for us to share ideas, learn new topics and socialize. We aim to break down gender barriers in the technology field and provide opportunities to create and expand technical knowledge through various projects, speakers, and events.


We want to make an impact, but we also understand that women are underrepresented in the field of technology. When I initially joined the club, the leadership was very strong among the officers whose willing to devote their time to getting to know each member, filling club time with ice breakers and activities. As cheesy as cliche as this may sound, I felt my personal growth as a club member, our club demonstrated to me how one individual is cable and can truly impact the community. We archive this by engaging ourselves in helping our community, which may be mentoring people with career concerns or course tutoring.


Being able to corporate with the team, think strategically, and adapt civic-mindedness thinking, I gradually strengthened my leadership skills. In fact, a year later I was able to organize events just like senior officers I had admired. We started Girl’s Who Code event which allows the younger generation the opportunity to learn about coding and gain confidence knowing that are capable in this field just like everybody else. Our club activities inspired me to be as compassionate, confident, and selfless when it came to committing my time to worthwhile endeavors. Which is always rewarding!
